com.bluegosling.util

Class PrimeIterator<T extends Number & Comparable<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bluegosling.util.PrimeIterator<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of numeric value generated
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterator<T>

    public abstract class PrimeIterator<T extends Number & Comparable<T>>
extends Object
implements Iterator<T>
    Iterates through prime numbers. The sequence enumerates all primes, starting with two. The sequence is complete when the maximum possible range is exhausted. For example, an iterator of prime byte values stops after the largest prime that is less than or equal to 127 (which is the maximum value that can be represented by a byte). Since BigInteger has no maximum value, the hasNext() method of an iterator of prime BigIntegers will never return false.

    This is implemented using a Sieve of Eratosthenes. This implementation is an incremental sieve, so it has no fixed upper bound other than being bound by heap space. Generating the nth prime requires O(n) memory, so a lot of memory is required for very large n.

    The phrase "current numeric type" in the documentation refers to the concrete type for type argument T. For example, with a PrimeIterator<Long>, the "current numeric type" would be long.

      • primeIntegerIterator

        public static PrimeIterator<Integer> primeIntegerIterator()
        Constructs an iterator of ints that are prime. There are enough primes in this range that the heap could be exhausted before enumerating all of them.
        Returns:
        an iterator of prime ints

      • primeBigIntegerGenerator

        public static PrimeIterator<BigInteger> primeBigIntegerGenerator()
        Constructs an iterator of BigIntegers that are prime. Since this class allows for arbitrary precision and word length, this will generate primes until the heap is exhausted. In other words, hasNext() will never return false.
        Returns:
        an iterator of prime BigIntegers

      • primeBigDecimalGenerator

        public static PrimeIterator<BigDecimal> primeBigDecimalGenerator()
        Constructs an iterator of BigDecimals that are prime. Since this class allows for arbitrary precision and word length, this will generate primes until the heap is exhausted. In other words, hasNext() will never return false.
        Returns:
        an iterator of prime BigDecimals

      • inc

        protected abstract T inc(T t)
        Returns the specified value, incremented by one. If the specified value is already the greatest representable value (e.g. incrementing would overflow) then null is returned.
        Parameters:
        t - the value
        Returns:
        the specified value plus one or null on overflow

      • add

        protected abstract T add(T t1,
                         T t2)
        Adds two values and returns their sum. If their sum would overflow the current numeric type (for example, a sum greater than 232 - 1 with 32-bit signed integers) then null is returned.
        Parameters:
        t1 - the first addend
        t2 - the second addend
        Returns:
        the sum of the two addends or null on overflow
